entity.name: BiobankCategory
entity.description: This is the categories of the entries commonly written in the xls file in the first column with bold letters. Obviously this list should be cleaned up against a proper ontology.

entity.name: BiobankTopic
entity.description: This is the controlled list of values used in 'topic' such as 'Anal atresia','Birth weight and growth parameters', 'Birth, preterm'. Obviously this list should be cleaned up against a proper ontology.

entity.name: BiobankDataType
entity.description: This is the values of the biodata column, e.g. DNA, RNA, urine. Obviously this list should be cleaned up against a proper ontology.

entity.name: BiobankCoordinator
entity.description: This is the values of the coordinators.

entity.name: Biobank
entity.description: This describes a panel (or: cohort) of individuals for which data was collected within the biobank.

field.name: Cohort
field.description: the name of the Cohort/biobank [in investigation the name is unique], For example: Netherlands Twin Registry

field.name: Acronym
field.description: Acronym for this biobank. For example: NTR
field.label: Acronym

field.name: Category
field.description: A. Core Biobanks, DNA available, B. Supporting biobanks (DNA not yet available)

field.name: SubCategory
field.description: For example: Population, development, birth and growth

field.name: Coordinator
field.description: One or more contact persons for this biobank

field.name: Institutes
field.label: Institutions
field.description: Institute that are custodian of this biobankPanel (found in xls as Institutions). For example: VU

field.name: Approved
field.description: This field indicates whether the record is approved by admin/curator

entity.name: ChangeLog
entity.description: This contains changes to bbmri entities.

field.name: entity
field.description: the Biobank entity that has changed
